title: The authors reply: PTSD due to childbirth stands at between 3.1% (adjusted) and 5.8% (unadjusted)
abstract: Alcorn et al. (2010) was a prospective longitudinalstudy of the prevalence of post-traumatic StressDisorder (PTSD) resulting from childbirth events. Oneof the features of this work was not only to estimatethe absolute prevalence of PTSD, but to adjust theseestimates for pre-existing PTSD symptomatology andother more common postnatal symptomatology, suchas depression and anxiety. It is of course possible ifnot probable, that these affective expressions are comorbidor predominantly represent the same underlyingpost-traumatic sequelae.
